componentDescription: Uses an additional container component if ListItemSecondaryAction is the last child.

propDescriptions.autoFocus: If true, the list item is focused during the first mount. Focus will also be triggered if the value changes from false to true.
propDescriptions.button: If true, the list item is a button (using ButtonBase). Props intended for ButtonBase can then be applied to ListItem.
propDescriptions.children: The content of the component if a ListItemSecondaryAction is used it must be the last child.
propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.components: The components used for each slot inside the InputBase. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.componentsProps: The props used for each slot inside the Input.
propDescriptions.ContainerComponent:
The container component used when a ListItemSecondaryAction is the last child.
⚠️ Needs to be able to hold a ref.
propDescriptions.ContainerProps: Props applied to the container component if used.
propDescriptions.dense: If true, compact vertical padding designed for keyboard and mouse input is used. The prop defaults to the value inherited from the parent List component.
propDescriptions.disabled: If true, the accordion is displayed in a disabled state.
propDescriptions.disableGutters: If true, the left and right padding is removed.
propDescriptions.divider: If true, a 1px light border is added to the bottom of the list item.
propDescriptions.secondaryAction: The element to display at the end of ListItem.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.

root.description: Styles applied to {{nodeName}}. May be wrapped by a `container`.
